title: 道德經
source: Chinese Text Project (ctext.org) - James Legge translation

passages.en: (Great or overflowing virtue) Who thinks his great achievements poor Shall find his vigour long endure.
Of greatest fulness, deemed a void, Exhaustion never shall stem the tide.

passages.zh: 大直若屈，大巧若拙，大辯若訥。
passages.en: Do thou what's straight still crooked deem; Thy greatest art still stupid seem, And eloquence a stammering scream.
Constant action overcomes cold; being still overcomes heat.
Purity and stillness give the correct law to all under heaven.
